dict.string: 1. Which of the following is (are) true about computers? They accept input. They store data. They produce output.
2. A computer processes data in a device called the
3. A computer file is a named collection of data that exists on which of the following? Optical disk (CD or DVD) Floppy disk Hard disk
4.Computers that operate in essentially the same way are said to be
5Which of the following can supply input to a computer? A person The environment Another computer
I and II Correct answer is
6.Which of the following is (are) true regarding the abacus? The abacus was first used in India. Calculations are done using the abacus by manually moving beads.

7.Which of the following is (are) true regarding the comparison between transistors and vacuum tubes? Transistors are smaller and more reliable than vacuum tubes. Vacuum tubes are more energy efficient than transistors.

8. Which of the following is (are) true regarding the Analytical Engine designed by Charles Babbage? It was designed to be a general-purpose calculating device. It included the concepts of input, process, storage, and output of data.

9. Which of the following is (are) true regarding the application of computers in the education field? Simulation-based education can be used for medical training, molecular modeling, and military training. Computers can be programmed to provide language training and to correct the pronunciation errors users make.
Microprocessors can only be programmed for a single purpose.
Most microprocessors are as big as a human hand.
Microprocessors cannot be programmed after they are manufactured.
10. Which of the following statements concerning microprocessors is correct?

11. Which of the following statements about transistors and vacuum tubes is (are) true? Transistors are smaller than vacuum tubes. Transistors burn out faster than vacuum tubes. A computer that uses transistors would require more power than a computer that uses vacuum tubes.
An Intelligent Agent is a program that collects information about a user's behavior, and customizes the content on a Web site accordingly.
An Intelligent Agent is a program that keeps track of the product database, work schedule, and budget of a project.
An Intelligent Agent is a database that gathers information about the customer base, marketing effectiveness, and market trends in order to learn more about customers' behaviors.
An Intelligent Agent enables customers to search a consumer Web site.
12. Which of the following describes the functionality of an Intelligent Agent that is used in a customer relationship management system?

13. Which of the following statements is (are) true about transistors? They consist of microscopic circuit elements, such as wires, transistors, capacitors, and resistors, packed on a thin slice of silicon. They were used to replace vacuum tubes in computer systems.

14. Which of the following is (are) true regarding integrated circuits and microprocessors? Integrated circuits contain more electrical components than microprocessors. Microprocessors must be manufactured for each application separately, while integrated circuits can be reused.
Microprocessors can only be programmed for a single purpose.
Microprocessors cannot be programmed after they are manufactured.
Most microprocessors are as big as a human hand.
15. Which of the following statements concerning microprocessors is correct?

16. Which of the following is (are) true regarding the Pascaline? It is an electronic calculating device. It uses vacuum tubes for performing mathematical operations. It uses punched cards for storing program instructions.

17. Which of the following is (are) true regarding the use of punched cards in computers? Punched cards use a technique that was originally used in Jacquard looms. Punched cards can be used to store program instructions, but not data.

18. Which of the following is (are) true regarding the application of computers in the business field? Computers can be used in supply chain management both for tracking the supply of raw materials as well as the supply of finished products. Customer-relationship-management software systems enable customers to place orders and provide mechanisms to process placed orders.

19. Which of the following is (are) true regarding the application of computers in the education field? Simulation-based education can be used for medical training, molecular modeling, and military training. Computers can be programmed to provide language training and to correct the pronunciation errors users make.
20. Which of the following is (are) true regarding vacuum tubes? They can be used to control the flow of electrons. They perform computations more quickly than mechanical components.
21 How many bits are required to store any given number in the range 0 to 255?
22. What is the decimal equivalent of the binary number 1101010?
23. Which of the following is approximately equivalent to 160,000,000 bytes? 160 Megabytes 16 Nanobytes 0.16 Gigabytes
A byte is the smallest unit of information in a computer. A bit is a collection of bytes.
A byte represents the values 0 and 1, while a bit represents a range of values from 0 to 255.
A bit is the smallest unit of information in a computer. A byte is a collection of bits.
There is no difference between bits and bytes. The terms are used interchangeably.
24. Of the following, which best describes the difference between bits and bytes?
25. What is the binary equivalent of the decimal number 123?
Looking up and storing information on customer accounts
Monitoring the operation of an automobile engine
Performing business calculations for a financial report
Processing requests to send and receive email
26. Which of the following kinds of projects typically requires a special type of CPU that would not be found in a desktop or mainframe computer?
27. Which of the following manufacturers provides the Pentium family of processors for desktop computers?
28. A computer clock with a speed of 100 MHz cycles how many times per second?

29. Which of the following can be an advantage of buying a computer that contains a widely-used CPU or its equivalent clone? A lot of established computer suppliers provide products using that type of CPU. The cost of the CPU is likely to be lower because of the large quantities of the CPU that have been sold. There will be more operating systems that work with that type of CPU.
30. Of the following types of memory, which is least expensive?
media that can be removed from the computer
a constant source of electrical power
31. In order to retain data for future reference, volatile storage requires 31
32. An Arithmetic/Logic Unit typically performs which of the following operations? Retrieval of instructions from RAM Performance of greater-than and less-than comparisons
33. Which of the following is (are) true of ROM? ROM is volatile. The instructions needed to boot a computer are typically stored in ROM.
34. Which of the following types of memory typically holds computer configuration settings and is powered by a small battery?
It cannot be determined whether program P will run faster on computer A or on computer B without knowing more about program P.
Program P runs faster on Computer B than it does on computer A.
Program P runs faster on Computer A than it does on computer B.
It takes the same amount of time for program P to run on computer A as it does on computer B.
35. Consider Computer A, which uses a 1.2-GHz CPU, and Computer B, which uses a 1-GHz CPU. For any given program P, which of the following is true?
36. Which of the following is (are) true of modern microprocessors? Microprocessor chips are typically the size of a deck of cards. Microprocessors typically contain millions of transistors.
37. Where is a computer's CPU located?
38. Which of the following components is (are) typically found on the motherboard of a computer? Expansion slots The microprocessor The CMOS memory chip
39. When a computer is turned on, the central processing unit performs instructions specified by the _____ that searches the disk drive for the main operating system files.

To execute only the instructions within a user specified application
To execute any program's instructions stored in RAM
To determine if a program functions correctly before using it

To execute any program's instructions stored in RAM
To determine if a program functions correctly before using it
To execute only the instructions within a user specified application

Another computer via the telephone lines

51. Desktop computer expansion slots include which of the following? PCMCIA PCI AGP

52. Which of the following is (are) true of a bus on the motherboard? A bus is not critical to the overall performance of a computer system. A bus is used to transport data between components on the motherboard. The CPU and other components use a bus to read and write data into RAM.

53. Which of the following considerations is (are) important when purchasing a graphics card for a computer? The type of printer The type of bus interface to be used by the graphics card Whether the card has a graphics processor to speed up processing

57. Input devices for a computer include which of the following? Digital cameras Scanners Speakers
58. A desktop computer expansion slot that is primarily used for graphics cards is the _____ slot.

59. Which of the following are true of Universal Serial Bus (USB)? A large number of devices can potentially be interconnected using the USB. It is used with many types of devices for transferring large amounts of data. It supports existing serial- and parallel-port devices.
60. Which bus transfers data between the CPU and the chipset?
61. Which of the following is (are) true of CRT monitors? CRT monitors are typically used in notebook computers. CRT monitors use electron beams to create colored light.
62. A monitor is primarily which kind of device?

63. Which of the following are important considerations when purchasing a monitor? The number of resolution modes supported The different levels of color depth supported The size of the viewing area that can be projected
64. Which of the following technologies uses a gun-like mechanism to spray the screen with dots of color?
65. Computer output devices include which of the following? Projector Microphone Printer
67. Which of the following components is (are) found on an accelerated graphics card? A processor Video memory EIDE
68. Which of the following is (are) true of USB computer connections? A USB hub can support up to 127 devices. Typically, USB devices can be connected without restarting the computer.
69. Which of the following is (are) true of computer printers? Typically, ink-jet printers have a lower cost per page than laser printers. Ink-jet printers are typically faster than laser printers.
s70. Which of the following is (are) true of computer printers? Typically, ink-jet printers have a lower cost per page than laser printers. Ink-jet printers are typically faster than laser printers.

72. A computer bus that transfers data twice per cycle is said to be double

Ink-jet and laser printers have a similar cost per printed page when printing large quantities of pages.
Laser printers have a wide price range and are more expensive than ink jets.
Ink jets have a slower print speed.
Both ink-jet and laser printers produce fairly high quality graphics.

Their access times are generally twice as long as RAM access times.
They require power to retain information.
Their capacity is currently measured in MB.
They use magnetic material to store information.
83. Which of the following is true of hard disk drives?
84. Of the following storage media, which has the largest capacity?
85. Floppy disks typically hold about _____ of data, while hard disk drives typically hold several _____ of data
86. Of the following types of storage, which provides the fastest access to data?
87. Which of the following are interfaces used with hard disk drives? AGP EIDE Ultra ATA
88. Which of the following is (are) true regarding flash memory? It uses electronic charges for recording data. It makes use of moving parts inside the chip for storing data.
89. Which of the following are appropriate storage media for archiving the tens of millions of bytes of data typically found on a PC hard disk drive? A floppy disk A magnetic tape cassette A Jaz disk
90. Which of the following is (are) true regarding floppy disks and Zip disks? Zip disks are capable of storing more data than floppy disks. Floppy disks transfer data more quickly than Zip disks.
Organizing file data that spans multiple disk platters so as to occupy one side of a platter completely, prior to overflowing onto a different platter
Organizing file data on different disk drives to allow for simultaneous access of the data
Organizing file data on a disk in consecutive sectors and tracks to minimize the time required to position the disk head to the proper location
Organizing file data in consecutive sectors to take advantage of faster rotational speeds
91. Which of the following is not a useful strategy for organizing file data on disks so as to access the data in the shortest possible time?

92. When purchasing a hard disk drive, which of the following are major considerations in deciding between hard disk drives that are similar in price and capacity? The speed at which their platters rotate The length of their access times The speed with which they transfer data to primary memory
93. Examples of magnetic media include which of the following? Floppy disks Zip disks Hard disks
94. Floppy disks typically hold about _____ of data, while hard disk drives typically hold several _____ of data
95. Of the following types of storage, which provides the fastest access to data?
96. Which of the following is (are) true regarding flash memory? It uses electronic charges for recording data. It makes use of moving parts inside the chip for storing data.
Their access times are generally twice as long as RAM access times.
They require power to retain information.
They use magnetic material to store information.
Their capacity is currently measured in MB.
97. Which of the following is true of hard disk drives?
A copy of the document is loaded from the disk into cache memory and edited in the cache.
The document image is directly edited on the disk where it resides.
The document image is moved to free space on the disk where the image is directly edited.
A copy of the document is loaded from the disk into RAM and edited in RAM
98. Of the following, which best describes what happens when a user opens a document for editing?

99.Which of the following is (are) true regarding flash memory storage devices? Flash memory storage devices are generally used in small devices like digital cameras and personal digital assistants. CompactFlash and SmartMedia cards are examples of flash memory storage devices.
The document image is moved to free space on the disk where the image is directly edited.
A copy of the document is loaded from the disk into RAM and edited in RAM.
The document image is directly edited on the disk where it resides.
A copy of the document is loaded from the disk into cache memory and edited in the cache.
100. Of the following, which best describes what happens when a user opens a document for editing?
It takes a longer time to transfer data from the peripheral devices to the chipset.
The processor performance will be less than optimal.
It takes a longer time to transfer data from the hard disk to the cache.
Instructions have to be loaded frequently from the hard disk.
101. Which of the following is a reason for degradation in computer system performance due to insufficient cache memory?
By replacing long sequences of identical data with a special coded format
By using higher density disk and RAM components
By using higher speed disks, enabling them to be read back faster
By writing in the empty spaces between the sectors on a disk drive
102. How are data files compressed into shorter sequences of bytes?
103. Which of the following areas of computer technology does Moore's Law impact in some way? Cost of software Processor speeds Amount of RAM on a chip

104. If Moore's Law holds true for disk capacities and if the largest disk currently available is 10GB, what is predicted to be the largest disk capacity six years from now, assuming an 18 month cycle to double capacity?
105. What is the general term used to describe the process of recoding data so that it requires fewer bytes of storage space?

106. Which of the following create performance bottlenecks? Disk access speed is too slow when compared to CPU processing speed. RAM access speed is too slow when compared to CPU processing speed. Bus transfers to network cards and video cards are too slow when compared to CPU processing speed.
Approximately the same amount of money paid for the old computer
Approximately twice the amount of money paid for the old computer
Approximately half the amount of money paid for the old computer
Approximately three times the amount of money paid for the old computer

107. Consumer demand for more powerful desktop computers continues to grow at a rapid pace, keeping up with the technological advances predicted by Moore's Law. If a user purchased a state-of-the-art computer 18 months ago, what should such a user expect to pay for a computer today that is twice as powerful as the computer that is now 18 months old?
encourages the use of memory intensive techniques
requires the CPU to run programs faster
results in decreased use of memory
108. According to Parkinson's Law of Data, additional memory
109. Which of the following kinds of files can be significantly compressed, while having little impact on the processing speed of other running applications when the compressed file data is accessed?
limited by the ability to shrink circuit paths to sizes smaller than an atom
limited by the purity of silicon, iron, and copper used to make high quality semiconductors
limited by the availability of silicon from which to make high quality semiconductors
not limited and will continue on throughout the 21st century
110. In the future, continued technological advances that follow Moore's Law are
It takes a longer time to transfer data from the hard disk to the cache.
Instructions have to be loaded frequently from the hard disk.
The processor performance will be less than optimal.
It takes a longer time to transfer data from the peripheral devices to the chipset
111. Which of the following is a reason for degradation in computer system performance due to insufficient RAM?
You cannot load and execute a program unless there is sufficient RAM to hold all of a program's CPU instructions.
Multitasking and large programs run slowly if there is insufficient RAM.
Programs cannot access files unless the entire file is first loaded into RAM.
RAM continues to be less expensive than hard disk memory.
112. Why is it important to have large amounts of RAM in a computer system?

113. Which of the following is (are) true regarding bottlenecks that degrade the performance of a computer system? Slow transfer of data between components in a system constitutes a bottleneck. A slow video card can constitute a bottleneck for graphics applications.
114. Which of the following layers are contained within the software of an operating system? Device drivers Kernel BIOS
device drivers hide the details involved with accessing storage devices from the operating system
the API provides a consistent interface to the storage devices
storage devices perform the actual file management on their own media
all physical storage devices operate basically the same way with respect to accessing data
115. The file system of an operating system can easily work with files on diverse types of storage devices because
116. Which of the following could contain a Master Boot Record? Hard disk drive Floppy disk drive RAM
117. Which of the layers of software that make up a computer system provides applications with direct access to the operating system?
The operating system creates an environment for the simultaneous execution of applications.
The operating system quickly switches the CPU back and forth between applications.
The operating system contains accounts for multiple users.
The operating system continues to run at the same time input/output devices are running.
118. How does the operating system support multiple applications running concurrently on a computer with a single CPU?
Only one device driver would be needed to communicate with all devices.
All operating systems supporting the standard could use the same device driver.
Device drivers would never have to be updated after they are installed.
Device drivers would require less software and take up less RAM
119. How would users benefit if the computer industry agreed on a standard for interfacing device drivers to operating systems?

120. Which of the following steps are performed by the BIOS during the boot process? Locating a disk drive that has an operating system to be loaded Loading the necessary device drivers needed by the operating system Loading into RAM the program to load the operating system
The operating system and hardware devices
The operating system and applications using hardware devices
121. Device drivers facilitate communication between which layers of the system?
122. Which of the following services are provided by the BIOS? Orchestration of the initial boot process Management of file creation and file deletion Basic support for devices such as the keyboard

123. Which of the following consequences are likely to happen when increasing the amount of time that each application can use the CPU, before the operating system preempts to allow another application to use the CPU? A runnable process will have a greater amount of access to the CPU once it becomes a running task. There will be fewer blocked processes. Fewer processes can be multitasked by the operating system.

124. A computer has one floppy disk drive, labeled A, and two hard disks, labeled C and D. Which of the following lists the drives in the order, first-to-last, that the BIOS would typically check during the boot process to find an operating system to load?

125. Which of the following are true about a context switch being performed by the operating system during multitasking? It occurs whenever the CPU is switched to execute the instructions of a different task. It needs to save the CPU's registers for a process, so at a later time it can resume processing where it left off. In a system executing many tasks at once, it has little or no impact on system performance.
126. Which of the following are programs containing software instructions to be executed by the CPU? BIOS Device driver Operating system

127. The illusion of multitasking can be given by switching control of the CPU to a waiting task under which circumstance(s)? A task controlling the CPU is waiting for user input from a device. A task controlling the CPU is performing output to a device. A task has been in control of the CPU for longer than some predetermined maximum.
operating system, device driver, application, hardware
operating system, application, hardware, device driver
application, operating system, device driver, hardware
application, operating system, hardware, device driver
128. Which of the following software layer sequences correctly represents the task of saving a file with a text editor?
The hardware interface may be proprietary to a vendor.
The hardware interface on one vendor's product may support more functionality.
The operating system was released prior to the hardware product becoming available.
The new driver corrects problems that were discovered in the application's interface to the device driver.
129. Which of the following is not a reason why similar hardware products typically include their own device drivers to be installed on the system?

130. Which of the following options in the Windows operating system can be used to improve aesthetics and convenience? Using the Control Panel Using the View menu options in My Computer or Explorer Changing the settings used by BIOS that control the PC's hardware configuration
when the power supply is disconnected
each time a key is pressed
only when the ESC key is pressed
only when the ENTER key is pressed

132. Which of the following operations cause(s) a fault to occur? The hardware is asked to do something it cannot do. The memory's error correction circuitry detects an uncorrectable error. The program contains an illegal machine instruction.
an attempt to access a non-existent memory location
A device indicates to the operating system that it has received input.
The CPU stops the operating system due to an internal error.
Betty, a user, indicates to the operating system that she wants to stop an application.
An application informs the operating system that it has finished executing.
134. Which of the following is an example of an interrupt?

135. Which of the following statements are true concerning interrupts? An interrupt causes the CPU to stop executing the application program. All devices are assigned the same priority and their interrupts are handled in the order in which they occur. Interrupts are signals from devices that need immediate attention by the operating system.
136. Within Windows, where can a user find applications for changing the operating system configuration?
It contains files to be deleted automatically by Windows after the system is booted.
It contains a list of programs for Windows to execute automatically after a user logs on.
It is a safe place to store personal documents created by applications.
It contains the operating system files to be loaded during the boot process
137. What allows the Windows Startup Folder to be used to customize the operation of the computer system?

138. Which of the following is (are) true with respect to the implementation of virtual memory in a computer system? A page fault occurs whenever the CPU tries to access an instruction or data not loaded into RAM. Virtual memory support is provided by the operating system and no special hardware support is required. Excessive page faults can slow down access to other files on the disk.

139. Which of the following conditions cause the system to slow down due to page faults? The user is trying to run too many programs at the same time. The operating system is not using any virtual memory. The system does not have enough RAM to handle all that is demanded of it.
140. Which of the following indicates to the operating system that an application is referencing data not currently loaded into RAM?

142. Which of the following is (are) true of virtual memory and page faults? A page fault occurs whenever a task refers to something that is in virtual memory but not in RAM. A page fault always occurs whenever the operating system schedules a blocked task to start running. Page faults can occur due to too many tasks executing or too little RAM within the computer.

144.Which of the following are true regarding the use of virtual memory in a computer system? Virtual memory provides the illusion of more RAM than actually exists. Excessive use of virtual memory by a computer system can slow overall performance. The CPU executes instructions directly from virtual memory.
145. Which of the following structures is used by operating systems to describe to a user how files and folders, excluding shortcuts, are organized on a storage device?
146. When a user creates a file, the user must provide it with a valid file name that adheres to specific rules, referred to as file-naming

147. Which of the following is (are) true regarding the cluster size of a disk drive? A cluster is the smallest amount of space that a file can occupy in a disk. The cluster size will decrease as the size of the disk increases.
a copy of the original shortcut
a shortcut having the shortcut file as a target
the creation of a copy of the target of the original shortcut
148. Under Windows, creating a shortcut icon that points to another shortcut icon results in which of the following?

149. Which of the following is (are) true regarding the New Technology File System? NTFS has built-in recoverability feature. The cluster size varies in NTFS depending on the size of the disk. NTFS supports data access control and ownership privileges.

150. Which of the following are reasons for partitioning a physical disk drive into one or more logical disk drives? For file systems such as FAT16, smaller partitions use disk space more effectively. Partitioning a drive limits the size a file can grow to. If the file system is FAT16 and the drive is larger than 2GB, partitioning the drive is necessary to make the entire drive accessible.
Names must always include an extension.
Names must always start with a capital letter.
Names must be unique within that parent folder.
Names must be unique within the entire disk or partition.

154. Which of the following are true about the presence of hierarchical file systems within an operating system? Hierarchical file systems require all files to be stored in a directory. Hierarchical file systems make it easier for users to organize files. Hierarchical file systems require that all files and subfolders in a given folder have names that are unique.

167. Which of the following is (are) true regarding the use of a batch file? It performs a set of commands frequently typed in by a user. It performs a set of commands that are selected from a GUI using a mouse. It performs a set of commands after hours that do not require user input.
commented, making them easy to understand
written in binary instruction code for the CPU
168. Batch files and scripts are easy to create and modify because they are
169. Under Windows, what extension is used for files that contain a sequence of predefined commands to the operating system?
Programs written to use the Standard Input and Standard Output logical devices do not need to be rewritten to direct their output to the printer instead of the display.
A change to the Standard Output device remains in effect for all subsequent commands entered from the keyboard.
Standard Input can be mapped to a device or file that provides user input for a command or a program.
Standard Output can be mapped to a file that receives output of importance to a user for a command or a program.
170. Which of the following is not true regarding the use of Standard Input and Standard Output logical devices in a command line?
It specifies a group of files that are affected by the command.
It specifies a change to the normal function of a specified command.
It allows two commands to be included in a single command line.
It tells the command processor what command to execute.
171. What is the purpose of a switch in a command-line interface?

172. Which of the following is (are) true regarding the use of Standard Input and Standard Output logical device facilities provided through an operating system's command line interface? Use > abc.txt to change the Standard Output logical device to be the file abc.txt. Use << abc.txt the change the Standard Input logical device to be the file abc.txt. Use the | character between two commands, allowing the output of the first to be used as input for the second.
173. Batch files and scripts are analogous to which of the following in applications?

174. Which of the following is (are) true of a database? A database can contain a variety of different record formats. Each database can have only one record format. A database consolidates flat files into a single collection of diverse information.
175. A person, place, thing, or event about which data is stored is called a(n)
Fields and records, which can be used interchangeably
Records, each of which is comprised of a set of interrelated fields
Records, which form the smallest unit of data manipulated by a database

184. What type of language allows a programmer to use instructions that are more like human language, such as the BASIC command PRINT "Please wait..."?
185. Who of the following focuses on the software component of an information system, including software design, programming, and testing?
186. What is a subset of the English language with a limited selection of sentence structures that reflect processing activities?
187. Software _____ refers to the process of developing software using systematic mathmatical, engineering, and management techniques.
188. Which of the following indicates the proper sequence (from first to last) of four processes of software development?
It is an example of a code review.
It is a desirable practice, but it rarely occurs in the software industry.
It is an example of how some teams of programmers engage in hazing a programmer who is new to the company.
Even though this practice is often required by large companies, it is usually counter-productive to the software development process.
189. Which of the following is true about the practice of having programmers present their solutions to a team of programmers?

A Trojan horse is an entire program that a user might knowingly execute but without realizing that it will operate in a malicious manner.
A worm is a program that replicates itself on other systems and impacts computer operations by tying up critical resources such as memory or files.
A program virus is embedded within a program file and is initially activated whenever the program file is copied to the disk drive.
A boot virus is located on the area of a disk loaded by the BIOS during the boot process and is immediately activated every time the computer is reset or powered on
